Accessory_Mines_Set2_UC1.name: Azure Ammo Pouch
Accessory_Mines_Set2_UC1.description: A pouch of ammunition engineered to be used in the arcanic rifles favored by the Shrikes.

Accessory_Mines_Set2_UC2.name: Incendiary Kit
Accessory_Mines_Set2_UC2.description: A kit used by the Azure Shrikes in their turf war with the Rustreds. It may or may not explode in your pack...

Relic_Mines_Set2_UC.name: Alchemical Tome
Relic_Mines_Set2_UC.description: A haphazardly scrawled tome of potion recipes. In desperation, the Azure Shrikes began to drink the arcanic fuel known as Godsblood in a last ditch effort against the warring Rustred faction. Although the strength provided is fearsome, seldom do any who injest the liquid survive.

Accessory_Woods_Set2_UC1.name: Ritual Cage
Accessory_Woods_Set2_UC1.description: A wooden box locked with Reaver magic. After sunset something inside knocks violently.

Accessory_Woods_Set2_UC2.name: Ritual Eye
Accessory_Woods_Set2_UC2.description: An eye with grayed pupils. It seems to bleed the deeper one ventures into the woods.

Relic_Woods_Set2_UC.name: Ritual Totem
Relic_Woods_Set2_UC.description: A small wooden totem stained with blood. An eerie hush seems to fall upon the woods in the presence of this figure. If one listens closely, chanting eclipsed by screams might still be heard.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_UC1.name: Spoon of Good Fortune
Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_UC1.description: A beautiful piece of silverware which once called the halls of the Avar Throne home. The wealth of the Royal Family was known far and wide, though little evidence of its origin is known.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_UC2.name: Silver Fleece
Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_UC2.description: It is said, much like the Silver Codex itself, that which was formed of silver bore the Architects blessings.

Relic_AllLZs_Greed_UC.name: Rapacious Ring
Relic_AllLZs_Greed_UC.description: A simple golden band infused with the element of Greed. Small indents await the installation of jewels and gemstones. Just by wearing it you feel yourself... wanting.

Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_UC1.name: Book of the Eventide Prince
Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_UC1.description: A black book with silverine pages. The spellwork of the Eventide Prince was feared by all who opposed the Maze. It is speculated without the Prince, the Thousand Day War would have ended after the first year.

Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_UC2.name: Royal Adherent's Focus
Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_UC2.description: A pure black jewel touched by the Eventide Prince. Only his closest followers were honored with one of these foci.

Relic_AllLZs_Shadow_UC.name: Eventide Ring
Relic_AllLZs_Shadow_UC.description: This black-stone ring is cold to the touch. Kissed by darkness, its power grows with every death in its wake.

Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_UC1.name: Witch's Focus
Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_UC1.description: A focus once used by students of the Protean Witch's craft. It still seizes with Chaos.

Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_UC2.name: Tears of the Witch
Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_UC2.description: A small vial harboring a single tear stolen in the Protean Witch's final moments. The prismatic beauty is difficult to look away from.

Relic_AllLZs_Chaos_UC.name: Protean Ring
Relic_AllLZs_Chaos_UC.description: A small glass ring hosting a wisp of volatile light. When the relic settles upon a surface, the light within divides, forming a random array of gleaming dots.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_UC1.name: Blooming Scarf
Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_UC1.description: A bright green scarf overgrown with floral life. A little slice of peace seems woven into its threads.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_UC2.name: Blooming Claw
Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_UC2.description: The preserved claws of a Lurker. Flora energies have found their way into cracks in the keratin, sprouting bright flowers from within.

Relic_AllLZs_Flora_UC.name: Bloomborne Ring
Relic_AllLZs_Flora_UC.description: An ivory ring of unknown origins. Vibrant plantlife in its presence seems to decay, while waning flora grows in turn.

Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_UC1.name: Brightburn Scarf
Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_UC1.description: A scarf of concentrated Solar energy. It burns with red and amber light, yet feels only comfortably warm to the touch.

Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_UC2.name: Flametouched Claw
Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_UC2.description: The severed claw of a felled beast. Solar energy has seeped into its carcass. The claws burn all that they touch.

Relic_AllLZs_Solar_UC.name: Everbright Ring
Relic_AllLZs_Solar_UC.description: Upon first glance this brass ring is ordinary in every aspect. The discerning traveler may notice, however, a somber glow seems to light its bearer's way in Evenor's darker places.

Accessory_Event_GloomTear_Rare1.name: Fallen Star Shard
Accessory_Event_GloomTear_Rare1.description: A raw shard taken from the meteorites plaguing the Highlands. Although these fallen stars seem to corrupt everything they touch, Wayfinders have proved suprsingly resistant.

Accessory_Event_GloomTear_Rare2.name: Startouched Vambrace
Accessory_Event_GloomTear_Rare2.description: A vambrace found amongst the remains of a vanquished Gloomtear. The armor looks foreign to any known cultures, and it is seemingly soaked with concentrated Gloom energies.

Relic_Event_GloomTear_Rare.name: Ring of the Coming Star
Relic_Event_GloomTear_Rare.description: The stone upon this ring was refined from the meteorites crashing into the Highlands. With the Engineer's aid, its corrupting power seems to have stabilized, granting a steady supply of darkling strength.

Accessory_Highlands_Set2_Rare1.name: Scrapwork Oil
Accessory_Highlands_Set2_Rare1.description: A small container of specialized oil favored by the Geartooth's Scavenge Runners.

Accessory_Highlands_Set2_Rare2.name: Geartooth Toolbox
Accessory_Highlands_Set2_Rare2.description: A simple toolbox favored by the Geartooth Goblins. The wrenches within are perfect for tiny hands!

Relic_Highlands_Set2_Rare.name: Scrapyard Pendant
Relic_Highlands_Set2_Rare.description: A small pedant constructed of scrap scavenged from around the Highlands. The Geartooth are infamous for the myriad of goods they have stolen and rebuilt to use against their previous owners. Gears within this pendant seem to have stopped functioning, but an arcane battery still thrums with life.

Accessory_Ruins_Set2_Rare1.name: Archon's Tome
Accessory_Ruins_Set2_Rare1.description: A fanciful tome with text inked in silver. The tenets of the Avar Church were kept by its Archon Inquisitors at all times.

Accessory_Ruins_Set2_Rare2.name: Inquisitor's Seal
Accessory_Ruins_Set2_Rare2.description: The silver emblem of an Archon Inquisitor. Known as valiant warriors to those in service to the Avar Throne, outside the Imperium the Archon's ire was feared for centuries.

Relic_Ruins_Set2_Rare.name: Creed's Seal
Relic_Ruins_Set2_Rare.description: The silver emblem of a fallen Archon Commander. Charged by the upper echelon's of the Imperial church to excise the heretical threat brewing in Aurelian, Commander Creed of the Archon Inquisitors marched his legion into the Westreach to never be seen again.

Accessory_Mines_Set2_Rare1.name: Salan's Leather Pouch
Accessory_Mines_Set2_Rare1.description: A leather coin purse passed down through the ages. Its original owner spent his childhood in the Imperial slums. As he was often robbed by cutthroats in the alley outside his home, he began carrying two pouches. One with his real money, hidden in his boot. The other with a few pieces of copper which he laced with a homebrewed poison.

Accessory_Mines_Set2_Rare2.name: The Tactician's Pouch
Accessory_Mines_Set2_Rare2.description: A worn leather pouch used for keeping arcanic powders oft used in rifles. The initials read S.V.

Relic_Mines_Set2_Rare.name: Shrike Heir's Bag
Relic_Mines_Set2_Rare.description: Fragments and echoes have merged upon the Matrix here to form something new. This black box has been engraved with all the names of the Vex lineage who came before, and it will assuredly bear those who come after as well.

Accessory_Woods_Set2_Rare1.name: Forgotten Effigy
Accessory_Woods_Set2_Rare1.description: A small effigy sculpted from smooth black stone. The details in the figure seem to suggest it portrayed a nebulous figure attuned to the fauna and flora of the woodlands, but with so much degradation, identification seems impossible.

Accessory_Woods_Set2_Rare2.name: Consumed Effigy
Accessory_Woods_Set2_Rare2.description: This effigy is carved from a unusually crimson wood. It evokes a visage of a figure consumed by fire yet refuses to burn.

Relic_Woods_Set2_Rare.name: Restored Effigy
Relic_Woods_Set2_Rare.description: A torrent of power has flowed into this jade effigy. The figure it presents seems vaguely human to the eye, but touching the relic fills your mind with visions of erupting power. Hot and formless and eternal.

Accessory_Ruins_Greed_Rare1.name: Ailed's Cursed Copper
Accessory_Ruins_Greed_Rare1.description: A tarnished copper coin, chipped nearly beyond recognition. A vestige of power slumbers within. But only just.

Accessory_Ruins_Greed_Rare2.name: Ailed's Cursed Silver
Accessory_Ruins_Greed_Rare2.description: A small silver coin with a single chip on one end. It feels strangely comforting to the touch. Brother Mithras, librarian of the Codexâ€™s archives, left the order shortly after the founding of the Aurelian monastery. He took only a single Imperial silver with him.

Relic_Ruins_Greed_Rare.name: Ailed's Cursed Gold
Relic_Ruins_Greed_Rare.description: Reforged and reborn. This pristine golden coin enchants all who look upon it. It is said in the depths of Evenor's mountains and hills, the Great Curse still slumbers.

Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Rare1.name: Songstress's Pin
Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Rare1.description: A silver pin with black highlights traditionally worn by Eldren songstresses. Despite the reputation they hold with the surface nations of Evenor, not all Eldren follow a warrior's creed.

Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Rare2.name: Warrior's Pin
Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Rare2.description: A darkling pin, stolen from the attire of an Eldren warrior. Darkness guide their hand.

Relic_Ruins_Shadow_Rare.name: Eldren Pin
Relic_Ruins_Shadow_Rare.description: Echoes, Shadow, and Duskal blood have birthed this relic. Born of Shadow, the Deep Eldren carried a connection to the element none but they could understand. Yet as the millennia passed and their numbers multiplied, the kiss of Shadow began to fade from their veins, stirring crises in their cities below.

Accessory_Mines_Greed_Rare1.name: Golden Glove
Accessory_Mines_Greed_Rare1.description: A Shrike's glove encased in gold. If not for the strength of Greed flowing through this item, it would be entirely impractical to use.

Accessory_Mines_Greed_Rare2.name: Godsblood Bracer
Accessory_Mines_Greed_Rare2.description: The power of Greed has crystallized the Godsblood upon the exterior of this bracer, coating it with an amber hue.

Relic_Mines_Greed_Rare.name: Sash of Rapacious Blood
Relic_Mines_Greed_Rare.description: Godsblood twisted by the primal prowess of Greed have awoken during the forging of this sash. Little experimentation has been done on the interaction of Godsblood and the primal magics. Our success here would suggest the two elements are no stranger to coexistence.

Accessory_Mines_Shadow_Rare1.name: Blackstone Bracer
Accessory_Mines_Shadow_Rare1.description: A bracer forged of a sturdy black material. A cold sets into the blood of the bearer. And a want for destruction and death.

Accessory_Mines_Shadow_Rare2.name: Blackstone Gauntlet
Accessory_Mines_Shadow_Rare2.description: A gauntlet forged of a shimmering black material. A cold aura seeps from cracks in its exterior. In the heat of battle, the screams of the fallen stir in the bearer's ears, driving them to madness.

Relic_Mines_Shadow_Rare.name: Shadestone Sash
Relic_Mines_Shadow_Rare.description: Drawn from the Echo Matrix, the Blackstone has mutated. The ethereal quality of shadow has given the stone a malleable form in resemblance of fabric. Equipping this garment feels as if dressing in shadow itself.

Accessory_Mines_Chaos_Rare1.name: Fitful Bracer
Accessory_Mines_Chaos_Rare1.description: A sleek bracer found in the depths of the mines. A small compartment allows the wearer to keep a stash of ammunition for arcane weaponry.

Accessory_Mines_Chaos_Rare2.name: Fitful Gauntlet
Accessory_Mines_Chaos_Rare2.description: This gauntlet shudders and thrums indiscriminately. Surges of chaotic power fill it seemingly at a whim.

Relic_Mines_Chaos_Rare.name: Chaosborne Sash
Relic_Mines_Chaos_Rare.description: A sash brimming with Chaos energies. It seems to glitch and flicker in a way reminiscent of Gloomshadows.

Accessory_Mines_Flora_Rare1.name: Bracer of the Flower Knight
Accessory_Mines_Flora_Rare1.description: A worn bracer overgrown with plantlife. It is said Belrand the Butcher raided every settlement from Corlaan to Witherward, leaving naught but cinders in his wake. When he reached the Viridian Tower, his long campaign ended, and his transgressions were cleansed within the Tower's waters.

setItem.name: Evenor's Depths
items: Parrying Guantlet of the Flower Knight

Accessory_Mines_Flora_Rare2.name: Parrying Guantlet of the Flower Knight
Accessory_Mines_Flora_Rare2.description: A parrying guantlet layered with moss. This item was favored by the Viridian Tower's lone guardian

setItem.name: Evenor's Depths
items: Parrying Guantlet of the Flower Knight

Relic_Mines_Flora_Rare.name: Belrand's Oath
Relic_Mines_Flora_Rare.description: This relic was forged from a gemstone cairn hidden within the depths the Evenor. Words whispered long ago linger within. Whilst carrying it, you feel at peace.

setItem.name: Evenor's Depths
items: Parrying Guantlet of the Flower Knight

Accessory_Mines_Solar_Rare1.name: Guiding Glove
Accessory_Mines_Solar_Rare1.description: A sleek glove found within the mines. It seems to glow dimly when worn.

Accessory_Mines_Solar_Rare2.name: Guiding Guantlet
Accessory_Mines_Solar_Rare2.description: A guantlet adorned with a brightly yellow gem. The Shrike this was found upon seems to have been killed by his compatriots. Judging by the scene around him, he put up quite the fight.

Relic_Mines_Solar_Rare.name: Guiding Voice
Relic_Mines_Solar_Rare.description: This sash glitters with a sheen reminiscent of brass. Kindred whispers caress the bearer, keen to light the fires of guidance to any who are lost.

Accessory_Woods_Greed_Rare1.name: Stone of Greed
Accessory_Woods_Greed_Rare1.description: A gemstone found abandoned in the Frostmarch. It was been tempted by the force of Greed.

Accessory_Woods_Greed_Rare2.name: Greedborne Ring
Accessory_Woods_Greed_Rare2.description: A ring fashioned from a gemstone infused with the temptation of Greed.

Relic_Woods_Greed_Rare.name: Idol of Avarice
Relic_Woods_Greed_Rare.description: A statuette carved to feed a long forgotten force. You feel the idol drawing you to the deeper places of Evenor.

Accessory_Woods_Shadow_Rare1.name: Stone of Shadow
Accessory_Woods_Shadow_Rare1.description: A gemstone found abandoned in the Frostmarch. It was been gripped by the force of Shadow.

Accessory_Woods_Shadow_Rare2.name: Shadowborne Ring
Accessory_Woods_Shadow_Rare2.description: A ring fashioned from a gemstone infused with the Kiss of Shadow.

Relic_Woods_Shadow_Rare.name: Idol of the Abyss
Relic_Woods_Shadow_Rare.description: A statuette carved to placate a long forgotten force. You feel like the idol is somehow watching you.

Accessory_Woods_Chaos_Rare1.name: Stone of Chaos
Accessory_Woods_Chaos_Rare1.description: A gemstone found abandoned in the Frostmarch. It was been addled by the force of Chaos.

Accessory_Woods_Chaos_Rare2.name: Chaosborne Ring
Accessory_Woods_Chaos_Rare2.description: A ring fashioned from a gemstone infused with the uncertainty of Chaos.

Relic_Woods_Chaos_Rare.name: Idol of the Unknown
Relic_Woods_Chaos_Rare.description: A statuette carved to still a long forgotten force. The idol's wants are unknowable.

Accessory_Woods_Flora_Rare1.name: Stone of Flora
Accessory_Woods_Flora_Rare1.description: A gemstone found abandoned in the Frostmarch. It was been nurtured by the force of Flora.

Accessory_Woods_Flora_Rare2.name: Floraborne Ring
Accessory_Woods_Flora_Rare2.description: A ring fashioned from a gemstone infused with the caress of Flora.

Relic_Woods_Flora_Rare.name: Idol of Verve
Relic_Woods_Flora_Rare.description: A statuette carved to nurture a long forgotten force. The idol feels somehow at peace in your hands.

Accessory_Woods_Solar_Rare1.name: Stone of Solar
Accessory_Woods_Solar_Rare1.description: A gemstone found abandoned in the Frostmarch. It has been bolstered by the force of Solar.

Accessory_Woods_Solar_Rare2.name: Solarborne Ring
Accessory_Woods_Solar_Rare2.description: A ring fashioned from a gemstone infused with the strength of Solar.

Relic_Woods_Solar_Rare.name: Idol of Sol
Relic_Woods_Solar_Rare.description: A statuette carved to venerate a long forgotten force. The idol does not seem to cast a shadow.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Epic1.name: Spoon of Pristine Fortune
Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Epic1.description: A golden spoon. Not only is it entrancing to the eye, but you cannot help but think you've had nothing but good luck since picking this trinket up! You should definitely not let anyone else ever take it from you. Or even look at it. It's yours. All yours.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Epic2.description: A golden circlet. It would look beautiful atop your head, wouldn't it? And no one elses.

Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_Epic1.description: The Nightfall Sisterhood faded to obscurity shortly after the massacre at Kragan's Pointe. While the Maze generally tolerated their presence, Archons from the Avar faith acted swifly when news of the novel sect reached the Avar Throne.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Epic1.description: Adherents of the Cycle were well respected in the days before the Imperium. Some records suggest rather than endure persecution, they fled into the Frostmarch.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Epic2.description: A simple circlet. The flowers adorning this item seem to fade and bloom indefinitely.

Relic_Ruins_Greed_Epic.name: Regal Scarf
Relic_Ruins_Greed_Epic.description: A regal scarf commissioned for the Imperium's Archon Inquisitors. Expeditions into the cold reaches of the Frostmarch were rare and after many failed attempts to tame the wilds, considered a fruitless effort.

Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Epic2.name: Forgotten Valor
Accessory_Ruins_Shadow_Epic2.description: A box bearing the sigil of the Imperial Chruch found among the ruins haunted by monks of the Silver Codex. This artifact was a prize awarded to Imperial Archons for distinguished feats. Though, before its bearer's passing, it was surrendered in cowardice.

Relic_Ruins_Shadow_Epic.name: Shade-Threaded Sash
Relic_Ruins_Shadow_Epic.description: A frayed sash sometimes worn by members the Silver Codex. Energies of the Gloom seem to have become infused within the fabric, coloring the thread with dark hues of Shadow.

Accessory_Ruins_Chaos_Epic2.description: A small wooden box found among the ruins haunted by remnant Archons. Every morning the Archon Inquisitors cleansed their blades as part of a ritual in veneration of the Architects. This cleansing box was abandoned in the struggle.

Relic_Ruins_Chaos_Epic.name: Tattered Cape
Relic_Ruins_Chaos_Epic.description: The tattered remains of an Archon officer's cape. Chaos energies have seeped into the threading, inking the garment with a touch of violet.

Accessory_Ruins_Flora_Epic2.description: A small case infested with moss and fungus. An imperial sigil marks the box, but whatever it was before has succumb to the elements.

Relic_Ruins_Flora_Epic.name: Mossy Scarf
Relic_Ruins_Flora_Epic.description: Once the scarf of a proud Archon Inquisitor, this garment has faded with age. Flora energies have bloomed within its threads, seeding the scarf with a mossy exterior.

Now, at the very least, we know the Gloom can corrupt even them.

The cave where he sought shelter was, in fact, a den for a local sleuth of bears. It is said when he emerged the following morning, he was missing a singular tooth, yet carried this fang in return.

Accessory_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC1.name: Golden Ashes
Accessory_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC1.description: When a phoenix enters its death throes, golden ashes are born of its final inferno. The life force of the phoenix lingers in the ashes, strengthening those who bear them.

Accessory_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC2.name: Burning Feather
Accessory_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC2.description: Only a few feathers are left when a phoenix is reduced to ashes. The flames are cool to the touch, but the feathers can absorb hostile arcane energies.

Relic_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC.name: Eternal Talon
Relic_Event_TreasurePhoenix_UC.description: Caela Firesky, the greatest skyrider of the Golden Aerie, tore this talon from the great phoenix Avalar. She wore the talon on an iron chain, extending her youthful vigor far beyond her prime. Until, one day, she saw fit to shatter the talon's bindings.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Rare1.name: Green Crystal Phial
Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Rare1.description: Perfect for holding dewdrops or blood.

Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Rare2.name: Codex of the Twisted Roots
Accessory_AllLZs_Flora_Rare2.description: This bark-bound book reflects on the mysteries of sun and soil.

Relic_AllLZs_Flora_Rare.name: Tangled Comb
Relic_AllLZs_Flora_Rare.description: The tines of this wooden comb are twisted in intriguing patterns. Made by one of the great Woodwalkers of the Frostmarch, it reflects the deep and twisting roots of the wind and channels the element of Flora.

Accessory_Woods_Set1_Rare1.name: Herbal Powder
Accessory_Woods_Set1_Rare1.description: A small pouch holding a mixture of herbs and roots ground into a fine powder. Before the Gloom, the Woodwen were known throughout the Frostmarch for their potent medicines.

Accessory_Woods_Set1_Rare2.name: Mystic's Focus
Accessory_Woods_Set1_Rare2.description: A small glass focus with a bright yellow flower trapped within. The glass is warm to the touch.

Relic_Woods_Set1_Rare.name: Woodwen Totem
Relic_Woods_Set1_Rare.description: A small totem made from scavenged sticks, feathers and bones. Once used in cleansing rituals by the Woodwen peoples, this totem has not seen use in many moons.

Accessory_Ruins_Set2_UC1.name: Imperial Emblem
Accessory_Ruins_Set2_UC1.description: This gold medallion is emblazoned with the solar icon of the Avar Imperium. The Imperial city has been lost to the Gloom, but as long as champions cherish its memory, the Empire remains.

Accessory_Ruins_Set2_UC2.name: Five Blessing Ring
Accessory_Ruins_Set2_UC2.description: This silver ring engraved with the symbols of the Celestial Architects of the Empire. Though the Empire has fallen, the five blessings will strengthen those champions who stand against the Gloom.

Relic_Ruins_Set2_UC.name: Hieran's Bracer
Relic_Ruins_Set2_UC.description: This steel vambrace was worn by the Imperial champion Hieran Mazaran during the bitter War of the Twelve Talons. Hieran stuck his arm into the maw of an Aerie maelwulf, and you can still see the gouges on the steel.

Accessory_Ruins_Set1_UC1.name: Gloom-Touched Bracelet
Accessory_Ruins_Set1_UC1.description: A simple golden bracelet that exudes faint Gloom energy.

Accessory_Ruins_Set1_UC2.name: Researcher's Journal
Accessory_Ruins_Set1_UC2.description: A leatherbound book full of notes of experiments conducted by an Aurelian monk.

Relic_Ruins_Set1_UC.name: Amulet of the Architect
Relic_Ruins_Set1_UC.description: A ceremonial gold pendant worn by the highest order of Aurelian monks.

Accessory_Ruins_Chaos_Rare1.name: Charged Ether Fragment
Accessory_Ruins_Chaos_Rare1.description: A raw sliver of chaos, shifting in color and brilliance. Its Chaotic emanations distract enemies, deflecting blows and strengthening your attacks.

Accessory_Ruins_Chaos_Rare2.name: Comb of Chaos
Accessory_Ruins_Chaos_Rare2.description: This golden comb creates more knots than it removes, but it sharpens your eyes and your blades.

Relic_Ruins_Chaos_Rare.name: Jeweled Butterfly
Relic_Ruins_Chaos_Rare.description: Ever shifting between caterpillar and butterfly, this Chaotic amulet grants resilience and resolve. Like the caterpillar, you can evolve to face your challenges.

Accessory_Ruins_Flora_Rare1.name: Emerald Fang
Accessory_Ruins_Flora_Rare1.description: The Venom Queen slew her enemies with poison, but also used unusual toxens to strengthen her champions. This jade ring digs into your flesh with tiny fangs, and its venom enhances your resilience and resolve.

Accessory_Ruins_Flora_Rare2.name: Black Serpent Bracer
Accessory_Ruins_Flora_Rare2.description: The Black Serpents were the elite warriors of the infamous Venom Queen. This serpentine bracer numbs your pain receptors, granting the illusion of health.

Relic_Ruins_Flora_Rare.name: Venom's Heart
Relic_Ruins_Flora_Rare.description: Though she had vast armies, the Venom Queen took great joy in personally assassinating her enemies. She forged this emerald ring to reveal the weakness of her foes, allowing her to eliminate the strongest enemy with a single critical hit.

Accessory_Ruins_Solar_Rare1.name: Solar Incense
Accessory_Ruins_Solar_Rare1.description: Harvested in the Dominion of the Seven Winds, this incense is infused with Solar energy and carries the scent of rejuvenating flame.

Accessory_Ruins_Solar_Rare2.name: Heart of Flame
Accessory_Ruins_Solar_Rare2.description: Forged by Dalar of the Five Flames, this gem blazes with the power of a miniature star.

Relic_Ruins_Solar_Rare.name: The Song of Fire
Relic_Ruins_Solar_Rare.description: This book holds hymns to the Conquering Sun written in gleaming gold ink. The Brotherhold of the Flame would praise this Architect before each battle, promising to fight until they were reduced to ashes.

Accessory_Highlands_UC1.name: Maze Emblem
Accessory_Highlands_UC1.description: A sharp point projects from this steel ring; Maze soldiers jab themselves when they need a surge of adrenaline.

Accessory_Highlands_UC2.name: Band of Courage
Accessory_Highlands_UC2.description: A sharp point projects from this steel ring; Maze soldiers jab themselves when they need a surge of adrenaline.

Relic_Highlands_UC.name: Conqueror's Chain
Relic_Highlands_UC.description: Gragor Steelskin was the first great champion of the Maze. He forged this chain from the manacles he'd worn as a prisoner of the Empire, and it channels a fragment of his rage.

Accessory_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare1.name: The Silver Codex
Accessory_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare1.description: Inscribed in silver ink, this small book contains the faith and mantras of the Silver Codex monks.

Accessory_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare2.name: Key of Dreams
Accessory_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare2.description: A ring in the form of a silver key, wrapping around the finger. A symbol of authority among the Order of the Silver Codex, it's said to defend the bearer by manifesting a shield formed from dreams; but you've seen the Gloom, and this ring channels its energy.

Relic_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare.name: Codex Locket
Relic_Fam_RemnantMonks_Rare.description: Shaped like a book, this locket holds a fragment of the original Silver Codexâ€“the book said to have been written by the Celestial Architects at the dawn of the second age. Arcane power pours from this small scrap of parchment, infusing vibrations into the air.

Accessory_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare1.name: Archon's Eye
Accessory_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare1.description: Emblazoned to shine with the visage of a golden sun, this medallion is the badge of an Imperial inquisitor. The Archon's Eye is said to expose both lies and weaknesses.

Accessory_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare2.name: Gauntlet of Inquisition
Accessory_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare2.description: The Archons are the inquisitors of the Avar Imperium, charged to root out heresy and all forms of evil. They enforce justice with an iron fistâ€”and this gauntlet is that fist.

Relic_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare.name: Templar's Creed
Relic_Fam_RemnantCrusaders_Rare.description: This book holds the writ given to Halus Aer, the first Archon and champion of the Imperial church; it imbues the bearer with a fraction of his zeal and determination.

Accessory_Fam_Gloom_Rare1.name: Last Breath
Accessory_Fam_Gloom_Rare1.description: This phial holds the final breath of a fallen Primal.

Accessory_Fam_Gloom_Rare2.name: Codex of the Shadow's Whisper
Accessory_Fam_Gloom_Rare2.description: This small book holds many secrets, but it can only be read in darkness.

Relic_Fam_Gloom_Rare.name: Eldren Ring
Relic_Fam_Gloom_Rare.description: Humans who wear Eldren treasures often die suddenly and unexpectedly.

Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare1.name: Bottle of Shadows
Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare1.description: Shifting darkness is trapped within smoked crystal. This is an ember of purest night, and its cooling shadows strengthen your resilience.

Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare2.name: Essence of Night
Accessory_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare2.description: A locket formed of dark iron. It's sealed by a powerful enchantment and cannot be opened, but motes of shadow slip between the cracks.

Relic_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare.name: Shadow-Inked Journal
Relic_AllLZs_Shadow_Rare.description: A personal journal written in ink infused with the essence of shadows. It belonged to Avaness, the infamous Eldren assassin who served House Harrakor during the Thousand Day's War. A few of the journal's pages are stained with the Grey Emperor's blood.

Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare1.name: Everchanging Codex
Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare1.description: There's a new story every time you open this book.

Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare2.name: Flask of Mystery
Accessory_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare2.description: The contents of the flask are forever changing, but it always gives you strength.

Relic_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare.name: Shimmering Ashes
Relic_AllLZs_Chaos_Rare.description: The ashes in this pouch continually shift in shade and scent. These are the raw embers of chaos, sifted from the Gloom, and their energy flows through you.

Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_Rare1.name: Band of the Rising Sun
Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_Rare1.description: The sunrise on this golden ring inspires hope.

Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_Rare2.name: Ring of the Setting Sun
Accessory_AllLZs_Solar_Rare2.description: The sunset on this silver ring promises peace.

Relic_AllLZs_Solar_Rare.name: High Sun Amulet
Relic_AllLZs_Solar_Rare.description: This amulet was forged by Dalar of the Five Flames on the highest peak of the Dominion. Legend says Dalar tore a piece of the sun from the sky and fused it with the gold.

Accessory_Event_LootGoblin_Rare1.name: Sack Lunch
Accessory_Event_LootGoblin_Rare1.description: This goblin's sack contains a disturbing assortment of bones and scraps.

Accessory_Event_LootGoblin_Rare2.name: Goblin Disassembly Kit
Accessory_Event_LootGoblin_Rare2.description: Goblins will disassemble anything that isn't bolted down in ten seconds flat.

Relic_Event_LootGoblin_Rare.name: Geartooth Brooch
Relic_Event_LootGoblin_Rare.description: A rustic brooch worn by members of the Geartooth goblin clan. Tradition holds that fledgling hunters must venture into the Highlands and scavenge materials for a brooch before their Shuul will perform their initiation rites.

Accessory_Event_Trickster_Rare1.name: Ring of Absurdity
Accessory_Event_Trickster_Rare1.description: Is it made of candy? Does it change color based on your mood? We're not sure.

Accessory_Event_Trickster_Rare2.name: Turtlesaur Plushie
Accessory_Event_Trickster_Rare2.description: The most adorable thing in the world.

Relic_Event_Trickster_Rare.name: Winner's Circlet
Relic_Event_Trickster_Rare.description: An armband engraved with the phrase "I'm a winner." Upon equipping this band you feel a surge of unearned confidence.

Accessory_Fam_Beast_Rare1.name: Warbear Fang Earrings
Accessory_Fam_Beast_Rare1.description: The fangs from a warbear fashioned into matching earrings. The ends are slightly tinted with blood.

Accessory_Fam_Beast_Rare2.name: Turtlesaur Spikes Bracelet
Accessory_Fam_Beast_Rare2.description: A bracelet made of spikes from a turtlesaur's limbs.

Relic_Fam_Beast_Rare.name: Owl Gryphon Talon Necklace
Relic_Fam_Beast_Rare.description: A black talon fashioned into a necklace.

Accessory_Fam_Goblin_Rare1.name: Geartooth's Spare Cogs
Accessory_Fam_Goblin_Rare1.description: Slightly charred cogs from a Geartooth gadget. Strange runes are inscribed on it. The Goblins seem to pay these parts an uncharacteristic reverence.

Accessory_Fam_Goblin_Rare2.name: Mini Golem Toy
Accessory_Fam_Goblin_Rare2.description: A small toy golem made from spare parts. Its eyes occasionally light up.

Relic_Fam_Goblin_Rare.name: Shuul's Amulet
Relic_Fam_Goblin_Rare.description: The amulet worn by Geartooth Shuuls. It is warm to the touch.

Accessory_Fam_Bandit_Rare1.name: Shrike Supply Sack
Accessory_Fam_Bandit_Rare1.description: There is more food in here than any one person could eat in a year.

Accessory_Fam_Bandit_Rare2.name: Bomb Creation Kit
Accessory_Fam_Bandit_Rare2.description: A small bag with sectioned areas for explosive materials and casings. Easy to carry and put together bombs in a pinch.

Relic_Fam_Bandit_Rare.name: Damaged Diamond Earrings
Relic_Fam_Bandit_Rare.description: Gold earrings with large diamonds. The gold is bent and scuffed like they were put away in a hurry.

Accessory_Fam_Reaver_Rare1.name: Shard of Effigy Core
Accessory_Fam_Reaver_Rare1.description: A shard from the middle of a Reaver effigy. It pulses with a strange light.

Accessory_Fam_Reaver_Rare2.name: Vine Totem
Accessory_Fam_Reaver_Rare2.description: A vine with a pink flower encased in a small orb Gloom swirls around inside, slowly darkening the vine and its flower.

Relic_Fam_Reaver_Rare.name: Gemmed Reaver Amulet
Relic_Fam_Reaver_Rare.description: A large, golden necklace worn by Reaver warriors. It pulses with Shadow.

Accessory_Fam_Slime_Rare1.name: Rusted Ceremonial Knife
Accessory_Fam_Slime_Rare1.description: What was once a bejeweled knife used in ceremonies is now rusted due to time in the slime. It still shimmers with a strange light.

Accessory_Fam_Slime_Rare2.name: Spider-Eye Mask
Accessory_Fam_Slime_Rare2.description: Black velvet mask inlaid with several spider eyes, petrified with an unwordly sheen. The eyes seem to follow your every movement.

Relic_Fam_Slime_Rare.name: Dented Shining Circlet
Relic_Fam_Slime_Rare.description: A golden tiara with a broken gem in the center crusted with dried slime.

Accessory_Event_Colosseum_Rare1.name: Burned-Out Tracer
Accessory_Event_Colosseum_Rare1.description: Tracer charred after multiple uses and exposure to battle. It still glows dimly.

Accessory_Event_Colosseum_Rare2.name: Orb of Solar
Accessory_Event_Colosseum_Rare2.description: Developed by the Aurelian monks, a crystal orb glowing bright with Solar. It was used in Arclight Champion experiments.

Relic_Event_Colosseum_Rare.name: Rigor's Pendant
Relic_Event_Colosseum_Rare.description: A golden pendant with a large blue jewel in the center. The histories say this pendant was bestowed upon the fiercest inquisitor the Imperial church had ever known upon his consecration as an Archon Commander. Though his birth name has been lost to time, the Seeker's archives suggest he took the name Rigor.

Accessory_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare1.name: Mini Totem
Accessory_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare1.description: Small wooden totem similar to the ones Reavers build in their woods. It pulses with Shadow.

Accessory_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare2.name: Fox Face Ring
Accessory_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare2.description: Small stone ring with a fox head emblem in the middle and green jewels for its eyes. Occasionally the eyes glow for a moment and the emblem gives a small grin before returning to normal.

Relic_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare.name: Malformed Pendant
Relic_Event_PrisonBreak_Rare.description: A simple wooden pendant wittled into the shape of a gnarled vine. In the times before the Fall, the Woodwen of the Frostmarch bore these pendants in honor of woodland spirits. Corrupted by the Gloom, a hunger now twists the wood and swirls of smoke seep through its porous tendrils.

Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare1.name: Remnant Abbot Ring
Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare1.description: Worn by one of the abbots of Aurelian. The simple pale gold ring seems to glow with Radiant that helps to energize the soul.

Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare2.name: Remnant Head Researcher Bracelet
Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare2.description: Worn by one of the head researchers of Aurelian. A simple golden bracelet with an orange gems that glows with Radiant.

Relic_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare.name: Remnant Ardent's Pendant
Relic_RuinsBosses_Set1_Rare.description: Worn by high priests within the Order of the Silver Codex in Aurelian. The gem in the middle swirls with a mysterious green smoke.

Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare1.name: Remnant Enforcer Bracer
Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare1.description: Worn by one of the monks of Aurelian. While made of simple leather, it is warm to the touch. Monks claimed it helped them to break through their opponents defenses.

Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare2.name: Remnant Prayer Totem
Accessory_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare2.description: Commonly used by the monks of Aurelian. A small wooden totem in the shape of a diamond with gold paint lovingly painted into a unique pattern.

Relic_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare.name: Remnant Radiant Focus
Relic_RuinsBosses_Set2_Rare.description: Commonly used by the monks of Aurelian. A small golden loop with smaller loops attached used as a focus to channel Radiant light when forced into combat against a stronger opponent.

Accessory_Mines_Set1_UC1.name: Gnarled Chains
Accessory_Mines_Set1_UC1.description: Old chains used with the mining equipment that have been rusted and gnarled together. Many Shrikes in the mines use them as make-shift hammers and fashion accessories.

Accessory_Mines_Set1_UC2.name: Canary Statue
Accessory_Mines_Set1_UC2.description: Small rock statue of a canary in a birdcage with faded paint. If there is dangerous fumes around, the statue makes a soft whistling sound.

Relic_Mines_Set1_UC.name: Godsblood Pendant
Relic_Mines_Set1_UC.description: Necklace with a large yellow jewel characteristically similar to dormant Godsblood. Shrikes like to wear it as a status symbol.

Accessory_Woods_Set1_UC1.name: Bone Doll
Accessory_Woods_Set1_UC1.description: Several small bones tied together with a leather band that vaguely resemble a person. Its face, crudely drawn, has a large and almost menacing smile.

Accessory_Woods_Set1_UC2.name: Raven Skull Focus
Accessory_Woods_Set1_UC2.description: Four small raven skulls attached to a simple rod that jingles slightly when shaken. You occasionally hear raven calls despite no birds being near.

Relic_Woods_Set1_UC.name: Reaver Amulet
Relic_Woods_Set1_UC.description: Collar of three bells with a gem in the center. The amulet evokes the visage of a Reaver's trappings. Fumes of Shadow seep from the gem, causing some plants to wilt at your approach.

Accessory_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare1.name: Evergrowing Vine
Accessory_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare1.description: Bracelet from vines growing from inside a Hollowed One. It constricts to fit tightly around your wrist.

Accessory_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare2.name: Hollowed Oneâ€™s Heart
Accessory_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare2.description: Smooth bright orange gem found in the breastplate of Hollowed Ones. When held close to your ear, you can hear whispers in an unknown tongue.

Relic_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare.name: Charcoaled Effigy
Relic_Fam_HollowOnes_Rare.description: Effigy of a Hollowed One burnt and reduced to charcoal. The plantlife here seems to wither in its presence.

Accessory_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare1.name: Damaged Drill Head
Accessory_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare1.description: A drill head broken off from one of the mining drills the Shrikes use. Some Shrikes like to turn them into fashion accessories.

Accessory_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare2.name: Tendril Totem
Accessory_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare2.description: A glass jar with a tendril from a Gloom creature inside. Unknown magic keeps the tendril from breaking out despite the many cracks in the glass.

Relic_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare.name: Dented Crown
Relic_MinesBosses_Set1_Rare.description: A dented crown of simple design. The golden lacquer has begun to chip away, exposing a frame of iron beneath.

Accessory_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare1.name: Accursed Bracer
Accessory_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare1.description: A simple leather bracer with a large metal faceplate attached to it. The mouth slowly opens and drools oil if the wearer becomes agitated.

Accessory_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare2.name: Spiderâ€™s Fang
Accessory_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare2.description: Large fang taken from one of the spiders that inhabit the mines. Poison occasionally drips from the end although it no longer has any potency.

Relic_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare.name: Spore Pendant
Relic_MinesBosses_Set2_Rare.description: A smattering of bioluminescent mushroom spores have been trapped within the gem of this pendant. Beneath the shade of the forest canopy, the spores shall light your way.

Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare1.name: Beastly Claws
Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare1.description: Glove that some Reaver Warriors use with large claws of an unknown beast. The blood rusted on the claws denote how many kills the warrior has.

Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare2.name: Spirit Bottle
Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare2.description: A small porcelain bottle carried by many Reavers. The liquid inside is sweet and pleasant but is said to slowly corrupt your soul until you yearn for nothing more but the strange liquid.

Relic_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare.name: Shadow-Fused Arrowhead
Relic_WoodsBosses_Set1_Rare.description: A stone arrowhead infused with Shadow, staining the stone with a deep purple coloration. This token has been fitted with a leather cord to wear as a necklace. Few of the Reaver clan are allowed the honor of using them.

Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare1.name: Gloom-Touched Claws
Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare1.description: Claws from a mighty beast that has been overtaken by Gloom. Smoke sometimes begins to spread out from them, as though it is attempting to recreate its host again.

Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare2.name: Corrupted Totem
Accessory_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare2.description: A small sculpture of a panther that has been overtaken by Shadow and Gloom, warping its features in unnatural ways.

Relic_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare.name: Charred Antler Pendant
Relic_WoodsBosses_Set2_Rare.description: Pieces of burned antler from an elder grazer were fashioned into this simple necklace. Although ravaged by fire, the antler's foundations remain untouched, suggesting some form of arcane protection.

Accessory_Fam_Elemental_Rare1.name: Earthen Might
Accessory_Fam_Elemental_Rare1.description: A pendant with a piece of a Flora elemental encased in glass. Occasionally the wearer will glow light green.

Accessory_Fam_Elemental_Rare2.name: Storm's Fury
Accessory_Fam_Elemental_Rare2.description: A pendant with a piece of a Storm elemental encased in glass. The wearerâ€™s hair will float occasionally.

Relic_Fam_Elemental_Rare.name: Spirit of Pyre
Relic_Fam_Elemental_Rare.description: A pendant with a sliver of the primal Solar element encased in glass. Upon donning this item, the wearerâ€™s body temperature rises considerably.

Accessory_Fam_Deceiver_Rare1.name: Horn of the Deceiver
Accessory_Fam_Deceiver_Rare1.description: In-tact main horn recovered from the Deceiver. It pulses with Shadow and sometimes seems to shimmer like attempting to change shape.

Accessory_Fam_Deceiver_Rare2.name: Dormant Deceiverâ€™s Eye
Accessory_Fam_Deceiver_Rare2.description: Large gem with pink and blue smoke swirling around. If placed near an object like a chest, it begins to shimmer as though it is attempting to change shape.

Relic_Fam_Deceiver_Rare.name: Deceiverâ€™s Ring
Relic_Fam_Deceiver_Rare.description: Ring taken from body of a Deceiver that might instead be worn as a bracelet. Its size seems to shift without reason, sometimes becoming so small it threatens to amputate its wearer's wrist.

Accessory_Fam_Titan_Rare1.name: Titan Core
Accessory_Fam_Titan_Rare1.description: Large, smooth core taken from the Gloom Titan. It pulses Gloom energy and cycles between feeling molten hot and freezing cold.

Accessory_Fam_Titan_Rare2.name: Titanâ€™s Essence
Accessory_Fam_Titan_Rare2.description: Ichor that spilled from the Gloom Titan gathered into a simple glass bottle. When shaken, it expands and fills the bottle causing it to become warm to the touch.

Relic_Fam_Titan_Rare.name: Prophetâ€™s Hilt
Relic_Fam_Titan_Rare.description: A sampling of the cloth used on the hilt of the Prophet's colossal weapon. Traces of lapis flame dance among its threads. Though, they do not burn.

Accessory_Fam_Wurm_Rare1.name: Calcified Wurm Pouch
Accessory_Fam_Wurm_Rare1.description: Hardened wurm flesh that once stored its food. Calcified by the Dark Star, it has faint Gloom energy and small crystals on its surface.

Accessory_Fam_Wurm_Rare2.name: Exoskeleton Wurm Plating
Accessory_Fam_Wurm_Rare2.description: Part of the Hungering Wurmâ€™s outer armor, strengthened after its host ingested the Dark Star. Although long cracks are strewn throughout the plate, nothing can penetrate through it.

Relic_Fam_Wurm_Rare.name: Gloom-Touched Forcipule
Relic_Fam_Wurm_Rare.description: One of the pincer like appendages ripped from the carcass The Endless Hunger. Prolonged contact with a fragment of a fallen star twisted the great wurm into a bloated recepticle of Gloom energies. That power dwells within this forcipule still.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Rare1.name: Jewel-Encrusted Gauntlet
Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Rare1.description: Leather gauntlet gilded in gold and accented with several precious gems. Greed energy sometimes seeps out of it.

Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Rare2.name: Gold-Plated Music Box
Accessory_AllLZs_Greed_Rare2.description: A long broken music box plated with gold and covered with precious stones. The inside is lined with red velvet with remnants of gold dust from the items previously stored in it.

Relic_AllLZs_Greed_Rare.name: Gaudy Pendant
Relic_AllLZs_Greed_Rare.description: An opulent ruby lined with diamonds on either side of a heavy golden chain. The back bears evidence of an inscription that has faded away with age.

Accessory_Highlands_Set1_Rare1.name: Polished Spectra Ring
Accessory_Highlands_Set1_Rare1.description: A small ring with a piece of Spectra in the middle. It swirls and changes form and color based on the season in the Highlands.

Accessory_Highlands_Set1_Rare2.name: Lost Totem
Accessory_Highlands_Set1_Rare2.description: A small metal statue of a long-forgotten hero of Westreach. It radiates the power of Order.

Relic_Highlands_Set1_Rare.name: Glass Pendant
Relic_Highlands_Set1_Rare.description: Pendant forged from shards of Highlands Glass, a rock smoothed under the pressure of one of the Highlands' many waterfalls until hauntingly translucent. When held up to the light, it projects a rainbow.

Accessory_Ruins_Set1_Rare1.name: Gloom-Warped Journal
Accessory_Ruins_Set1_Rare1.description: Journal used by a researcher at Aurelian that has been transformed by the Gloom. While it can be opened, the pages are warped and mutilated, and the text is impossible to read.

Accessory_Ruins_Set1_Rare2.name: Orb of the Architects
Accessory_Ruins_Set1_Rare2.description: A clear orb with a strange machine inside that pulses occasionally with radiant energies.

Relic_Ruins_Set1_Rare.name: Adherent's Contradiction
Relic_Ruins_Set1_Rare.description: A large pendant with a pellucid gemstone inlaid in a silver frame. The stone bears a crack down its center. Radiant light swirls on one end and umbral Gloom upon the other.

Accessory_Mines_Set1_Rare1.name: Machinist's Journal
Accessory_Mines_Set1_Rare1.description: A leather-bound journal containing hundreds of diagrams featuring machinery enhanced with arcanic means. The models here seem far more advanced than any of Skylight's machinery. The final page is initialed HK.

Accessory_Mines_Set1_Rare2.name: Storm Wielder
Accessory_Mines_Set1_Rare2.description: The vambrace of a Storm Shrike. Despite its sturdy construction, its surface has become charred from contact with Storm energies.

Relic_Mines_Set1_Rare.name: Ichor Stained Statue
Relic_Mines_Set1_Rare.description: A small stone statue in the likeness of a raven. Godsblood has set into the creases, gifting the icon a lurid glow.

Accessory_Fam_Aquatic_Rare1.name: Barnacled Conch Shell
Accessory_Fam_Aquatic_Rare1.description: A large conch shell covered in barnacles harder than most rocks. One hit with the shell can break through most stone walls.

Accessory_Fam_Aquatic_Rare2.name: Ornate pearl ring
Accessory_Fam_Aquatic_Rare2.description: A large pool set on a simple silver band. The pearl shines with an unnatural light, and sometimes soft singing sounds like it is coming from it.

Relic_Fam_Aquatic_Rare.name: Shark Tooth Pendant
Relic_Fam_Aquatic_Rare.description: A simple pendant made of a large sharkâ€™s tooth bound with a leather cord. Dried blood still flakes the tooth, and in the right breeze, it still smells of iron and salt.

Accessory_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare1.name: Ancient Eye
Accessory_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare1.description: Eye taken from the turtlesaur that hardened in a gemstone like rock after death. Looking into it displays faint shapes and shadows of the things it saw during its long life.

Accessory_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare2.name: Frenzied Spores
Accessory_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare2.description: Hardened leaf from the Turtlesaurâ€™s neck marred with acid. You can feel it pulsing with Flora energy.

Relic_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare.name: Fungal Tooth
Relic_Fam_Turtlesaur_Rare.description: An enormous tooth pulled from the mouth of a deceased Thunderer. A thick green fungus has cultivated the remains. Flora energy blossoms continually from the tooth, making it strangely warm to the touch.

Accessory_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare1.name: Dragonkin Blood
Accessory_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare1.description: A vial of blood stolen from the corpse of a Dragonkin. Certain circles within the Avar Imperium touted the creature's blood as cure-alls for every ailment, healthy for one's skin, and even a powerful aphrodisiac. The truth of these claims has never been verified..

Accessory_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare2.name: Dragonkin Hunting Kit
Accessory_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare2.description: Hunting parties formed for Imperium nobility often sought to target Dragonkin in pursuit of glory. Few survived.

Relic_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare.name: Dragonkin's Scale
Relic_Fam_Dragonkin_Rare.description: A singular scale pried from a felled dragonkin warrior. When cast in a beam of sunlight, both crimson and cerulean coloration can be seen.

Accessory_Fam_Siren_Rare1.name: Siren's Fang
Accessory_Fam_Siren_Rare1.description: A single tooth taken from the maw of a siren. The size of this sharp fang tells a different tale than the rumors of their beauty might suggest.

Accessory_Fam_Siren_Rare2.name: Deafening Charm
Accessory_Fam_Siren_Rare2.description: This amulet was often sold to travelers venturing through the Witherward Coast. Whether its powers truly protected a lone wayfarer from the danger of a siren's song is uknown.

Relic_Fam_Siren_Rare.name: Iron-Bound Song
Relic_Fam_Siren_Rare.description: A small black box bound in iron chains. The power of a siren's song was feared even by the warriors of the Maze. When hunting the cunning creatures, rangers were known to carry iron weapons. Why Siren's feared such a modest metal is still unknown.

Accessory_Event_FightingPit_Rare1.name: Barbarian's Crown
Accessory_Event_FightingPit_Rare1.description: A pin of gnarled wood and thorns vaguely in the shape of a crown. Only those who have soaked in the blood of the fighting pits and emerged victorious dare wear this.

Accessory_Event_FightingPit_Rare2.name: Bestial Mantle
Accessory_Event_FightingPit_Rare2.description: A pin in the vague shape of a bestial maw. Traditionally worn by those who conquered the beasts of the fighting pits.

Relic_Event_FightingPit_Rare.name: Champion's Brooch
Relic_Event_FightingPit_Rare.description: A sleek black pin engraved with the visage of a ferocious warrior stalwart against a horde, forged from the refuse of those who challenged you. Even outnumbered, even surrounded, a true champion rises.

Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_UC1.name: Voidborne Gemstone
Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_UC1.description: A darkling fragment found within the void.

Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_UC2.name: Voidborne Ring
Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_UC2.description: Whosoever bore this ring saw fit to cast it into the dark.

Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_UC.name: Voidborne Tome
Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_UC.description: Can you hear it call your name?

Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare1.name: Stone of Silence
Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare1.description: It is clear someone fragmented this black stone with purpose.

Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare2.name: Ring of Silence
Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare2.description: You hear naught but the voice within.

Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare.name: Tome of Silence
Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_Rare.description: The book's pages are black as the void. In perpetuity it reads: "They are waking. They are waking. They are waking. They are waking. They are waking..."

effect.partial: +5% Total Max Health, Break Power, Physical Defense
effect.full: +10% Total Max Health, Break Power, Physical Defense

Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Epic2.name: Crumbling Ring
Accessory_Event_GloomDungeon_Epic2.description: While the ring itself seems in pristine condition, the state of reality surrounding it is crumbling.

Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_Epic.name: Book of Unwoven Threads
Relic_Event_GloomDungeon_Epic.description: Servant's hands wove a tapestry. Servant's hands would have it undone.

Accessory_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare1.name: Escavation Team's Toolbox
Accessory_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare1.description: Arcanic repair devices sported by Shrike maintenance personnel.

Accessory_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare2.name: Escavation Gauntlet
Accessory_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare2.description: A gauntlet powered by the element of Storm. While these models are primarily used in maintenance of Shrike machinery, they make excellent weaponry as well.

Relic_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare.name: Conflux Scarf
Relic_Event_EscavationUnit_Rare.description: A strange conflux of godsblood, Storm energies, and the power of Greed have fused into the memory this scarf was drawn from. It now subsists as a vestige of power.

Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common1.name: Woodknot Ring
Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common1.description: Carved from a bough of the First Tree, the woodknot ring is infused with positive energy and strengthens the lifeforce of the bearer. These rings come from the Frostmarch, where they are celebrated in the song "Would Not, Woodknot."

Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common2.name: Silver Shrike
Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common2.description: Before the Gloom, the smugglers of the Shrike Syndicate were celebrated as folk heroes by the people of the Broken Coast. This Shrike medallion was worn with pride by the champions of the guild.

Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common3.name: Bracer of Memories
Accessory_Ruins_GW1_Common3.description: This leather bracer is engraved with sigils recording the life of an Avar monk. You can draw on the faintest echo of the monk, enhancing your strength and health.

Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common1.name: Preserved Claw
Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common1.description: The claw of a creature found within stores in the Undercroft. The monks extracted biological material to use in their facsimile simulations, though for what purpose the Seekers are still unsure.

Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common2.name: Preserving Box
Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common2.description: A small box arcanically engineered to preserve the biological material used in the monk's experiments within the Undercroft.

Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common3.name: Preserved Voice
Accessory_Ruins_GW2_Common3.description: Lord Halar believes this gem to be a prototype of the monk's Tracer Orbs. It seems to contain vestiges of a member of their Order's voice.

Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common1.name: Scribe's Notebook
Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common1.description: A meticulously organized tome bearing notes and musings authored by the First Scribe. Damage to the text has made it mostly indecipherable, but the experimentation involved does denote an interest in the longevity of mortal creatures.

Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common2.name: Scribe's First Experiment
Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common2.description: A ring seemingly discarded amongst the ruins of the Repository of Knowledge. It sings with Gloom energies, but the unstable nature of the power within seems to compromise the integrity of the ring.

Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common3.name: Scribe's Discarded Ring
Accessory_Ruins_GW3_Common3.description: A ring seemingly discarded amongst the ruins of the Repository of Knowledge. It sings with Gloom energies, but the unstable nature of the power within seems to compromise the integrity of the ring.

Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common1.name: Jade Crane
Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common1.description: The hunters of the Golden Aerie admire the grace and precision of the striking crane. This totem can guide your hand and increase your Crit Rating.

Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common2.name: Sunsteel Salamander
Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common2.description: This icon is warm to the touch. Sunsteel channels solar energy, and you can feel the fury of the salamander burning within it.

Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common3.name: Ivory Spoon
Accessory_Mines_GW1_Common3.description: Made from the shell of a turtlesaur, this spoon toughens you up and strengthens your arm.

Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common1.name: Transport Guidance Manual
Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common1.description: A piece of tattered cloth used as masks by workers in the Bloodworks so that they might not breathe in arcanic fumes.

Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common2.name: Makeshift Mask
Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common2.description: A piece of tattered cloth used as masks by workers in the Bloodworks so that they might not breathe in arcanic fumes.

Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common3.name: Arcanic-Resistant Glove
Accessory_Mines_GW2_Common3.description: A glove used by workers in the godsblood mines. The material is resistant to arcanic fuel, though notably requires constant upkeep.

Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common1.name: Balgrim's Treasure
Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common1.description: A pouch of refined minerals found amongst the remains of a Balgrim. The powder glitters in the moonlight.

Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common2.name: Balgrim's Totem
Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common2.description: A broken and rotted tooth. The Balgrim hoard these, presumably, for the arcanic power that radiates from its remains. From what source is unknown.

Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common3.name: Infused Ore
Accessory_Mines_GW3_Common3.description: Remnants of the ore once sought from the ancient mine of Bal Duum. The dark mineral seems to have soaked in the surrounding Flora energies.

Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common1.name: Teak Turtlesaur
Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common1.description: The essence-weavers of the Golden Aerie say that the universe is comprised of a chain of turtlesaurs, each one larger than the one above. This talisman draws on the power of the Turtlesaur Below This World, infusing the bearer with fearsome might.

Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common2.name: Flamewood Phoenix
Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common2.description: Like the Phoenix, Aerie flamewood is restored when it burns. This token grants you a fraction of the resilience of the Phoenix, and can shield you from magical attacks.

Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common3.name: Shadowstone Deceiver
Accessory_Highlands_Area1_Common3.description: At first glance, this is a carving of a wooden chest. But it's acutally an Aerie totem representing the Deceiverâ€”a beast that uses deception to defeat its prey. The Deceiver's guile will strengthen your attacks and expose your enemies' weaknesses.

Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common1.name: Brass Bear
Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common1.description: In the Golden Aerie, warriors who carry the token of the Bear are renowned for their vitality and durability. When you carry this totem, you can feel the bear's might flowing through you.

Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common2.name: Iron Panther
Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common2.description: Forged from blackened iron and infused with primal essence, this totem can increase your health and durability.

Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common3.name: Prayer Beads
Accessory_Highlands_Area2_Common3.description: The name of an Architect is engraved on each bead, and the clicking of the beads is like a prayer.

Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common1.name: Tales of the Trade
Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common1.description: A red-leather tome filled with tales traditionally told by merchants and travelers along the Trade Road. In times past, they provided comfort in the darkness.

Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common2.name: Tales of the Geartooth
Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common2.description: A tattered tome written in the language of goblinkind. While the text is indiscernible to you, sketches inked into the yellowed pages detail a world of chaos and ruin.

Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common3.name: Tales of the Aerie
Accessory_Highlands_Area3_Common3.description: A beautiful tome with shining pages. It describes heroic tales of riders on unicorn mounts, descending the high mountains to slay whatever evils might thrive below.

Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common1.name: Petrified Wood Statue
Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common1.description: Small statue of petrified wood that resembles a turtlesaur. Small flowers grow from its back despite no soil.

Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common2.name: Purple Geode Pendant
Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common2.description: Simple leather chain with a purple geode attached. The geode gives off a faint glow.

Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common3.name: Glittering Amber
Accessory_Woods_GW1_Common3.description: A piece of perfectly smooth amber with a small butterfly encased inside. At night, the butterfly glows brightly and moves its wings ever so slightly.

Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common1.name: Sacrificial Totem
Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common1.description: A totem made from rotted wood. These are frequently found around sites used in Reaver rituals.

Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common2.name: Lost Ring
Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common2.description: A discarded and bloodied ring found among the effects of the Reaver's prison camps. An engraving within reads: Together Always.

Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common3.name: Ritual Bone
Accessory_Woods_GW2_Common3.description: A carefully carved bone to be used in a Reaver totem. Its origin is unknown.

Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common1.name: Caretaker's Necklace
Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common1.description: A ruined necklace worn by Woodwen who tended to the Heart of the Woods.

Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common2.name: Witch's Circlet
Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common2.description: A circlet traditionally worn by sorceresses respected by the Woodwen people. It is the duty of those closest to the old powers to place the Petrified Crown upon the Woodwen King's brow.

Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common3.name: Floral Mixture
Accessory_Woods_GW3_Common3.description: A mixture of ground herbs and flower petals slowly wither within this pouch.

Accessory_Gorge_Set1_UC1.name: Stoneskin Ring
Accessory_Gorge_Set1_UC1.description: According to Dominion researchers, the stone found atop this ring is commonly found in basilisk nests. Though the exact source of the material is still unknown.

Accessory_Gorge_Set1_UC2.name: Stoneskin Amulet
Accessory_Gorge_Set1_UC2.description: Stoneskin amulets fell briefly into vogue at the height of the Mazewar. Imperial soldiers claimed the smooth stones they brought home were prizes wrested from the corpses of chimeric basilisks, though Avar researchers commonly understand the rumors of basiliskâ€™s stoney gaze to be greatly exaggerated.

Relic_Gorge_Set1_UC.name: Stoneskin Bracer
Relic_Gorge_Set1_UC.description: Grotesque statues infamously populate the labyrinth of Cairn 02. Citizens of the Godmaze believe the statueâ€™s eternally tortured visages to be the parting gift of a great beast which now slumbers beneath the Pyrolith.

Accessory_Gorge_Set2_UC1.name: Storm Lord's Ring
Accessory_Gorge_Set2_UC1.description: The Arcane Lords of the Dominion were known to wear rings fashioned from crystallized Storm Jellies when visiting areas plagued with unrelenting tempests. It was thought in the event of a lightning strike, the ring might absorb the primal energies in their stead.

Accessory_Gorge_Set2_UC2.name: Sailor's Light
Accessory_Gorge_Set2_UC2.description: A simple amulet used by sailors in the Dominion of the Seven Winds. The luminescent glow was invaluable while out at sea where the cloud covered darkness often proved perilous.

Relic_Gorge_Set2_UC.name: Nyra's Glove
Relic_Gorge_Set2_UC.description: The Iron Sisters oft favored armor infused with the slumbering powers of beasts. It is said every arrow shot by Nyra of Faralyn arced like lightning from above. A fraction of her power slumbers within this relic still.

Accessory_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare1.name: Night Warden's Jewlery Box
Accessory_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare1.description: While the Shadow Nationâ€™s true goals seem fixated on something deeper within the Shatterlands, evidence of some archaeological sites organized by the Eldren have been found. This container has been kept with great care. Though not with reverence, but fear.

Accessory_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare2.name: Night Warden's Effigy
Accessory_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare2.description: A tarnished effigy forged in veneration. When Night fell, so did his plans for these shattered lands.

Relic_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare.name: Night Warden's Bracelet
Relic_GorgeBosses_Set2_Rare.description: As he perished at the Fatebreakerâ€™s hands, that which remained of Nightâ€™s creation shatteredâ€”devasted by the very stars he lit above. Only the Wardenâ€™s will lives on. Bound servants, guardians of the Nightâ€™s slumbering charge.

Accessory_Gorge_Chaos_Epic1.name: Tearsoaked Ring
Accessory_Gorge_Chaos_Epic1.description: The Shadow Nation speaks of their birth from blood. Yet power wells from the great onesâ€™ tears too. The mourning of what could have been.

Accessory_Gorge_Chaos_Epic2.name: Tearsoaked Amulet
Accessory_Gorge_Chaos_Epic2.description: Though it was she who stood as the lone victor, it was the Fatebreakerâ€™s tears that flooded the Shatterlands. Her great love, perished, not for she but the callous creators which betrayed them.

Relic_Gorge_Chaos_Epic.name: Fatebreaker's Favor
Relic_Gorge_Chaos_Epic.description: None held the Great Motherâ€™s favor but her first love. Despite his convictions, she forged him a charm of watchful protection as a parting gift on the eve of war.

Accessory_Gorge_Flora_Epic1.name: Corrupted Ring
Accessory_Gorge_Flora_Epic1.description: A simple ring overtaken by the corruption of the Hollow Heart. While Lord Halarâ€™s arcanists have yet to understand the intricacies of how the Heart works its seeds through the Gloom to reach distant lands, the threat it poses is clear. Left unchecked this corruption might grip everything we know.

Accessory_Gorge_Flora_Epic2.name: Corrupted Amulet
Accessory_Gorge_Flora_Epic2.description: An amulet infused with the corruption seeded within the Shatterlands. The old powers are waking. The Heart will have its revenge.

Relic_Gorge_Flora_Epic.name: Witch's Bracer
Relic_Gorge_Flora_Epic.description: A rustic bracer fashioned to channel the tainted power of Flora flowing through the Heart of the Woods. Whomever created this relic was vested in the primal powers and clearly seeks their return.

Accessory_Gorge_Solar_Epic1.name: Astalyn Dancer's Ring
Accessory_Gorge_Solar_Epic1.description: The ring of an Astalyn Dancer. A rarity amongst the Deep Eldren, these warriors divested themselves of the shadow's teachings to learn from the Astalyn dragons of old.

effect.full: +10% Total Weapon Power, Ability Power, Resilience

Accessory_Gorge_Solar_Epic2.name: Astalyn Dancer's Necklace
Accessory_Gorge_Solar_Epic2.description: The fourth trial is undertaken when the sun is highest. Once the young dancer has braved the fire, they are bestowed with a Astalyn scale. Many Eldren fashion their prize into something wearable.

effect.partial: +5% Total Weapon Power, Ability Power, Resilience
effect.full: +10% Total Weapon Power, Ability Power, Resilience

Relic_Gorge_Solar_Epic.name: Astalyn Dancer's Glove
Relic_Gorge_Solar_Epic.description: Few Astalyn Dancers remain since the Shadow Nationâ€™s rise. Though the martial tradition is not anathema to the Mother of Shadowsâ€™ teachings, few students of the dragons favored the Great Motherâ€™s return.

Accessory_Boss_Teryssa_Epic2.name: Scarf of Silence
Accessory_Boss_Teryssa_Epic2.description: A scarf favored by Teryssa during her youth as a Shadow Dancer. It is said young Teryssa looked upon the Great Mothers and saw not the promise of power, but a dream of freedom from her peopleâ€™s struggles.

Relic_Boss_Teryssa_Epic.name: Silence Reforged
Relic_Boss_Teryssa_Epic.description: A piece of Teryssa's tarnished mantle, reforged into a relic of power. When the Lord of Swords fell to the Beacon's light, the Precursor's lifeforce elevated the Eldren under his banner, forever changing their mortal shells. Daunted by the enrapturing power burning in her veins, Teryssa cast her loyalties aside, rededicating herself to her people.
